channel.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
channel.description:
So Umm.. I Know everything about making server. Except the password and username to the portforwarding part..
1 Guy posted me that i can reset my modem, And change username and password. Is It true? And if so.. how i do it? Do i lose files when i do it??
Or Is there easier way?? Find it?? Or something?? My mom dont know.
Another man from a company came to our house to install our modem. So he knows the passoword or username?
I doubt..
But If you know something about how to do this, PM ME!
Thanks! :)
-Lolsant

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Microsoft11 Microsoft1
item.source: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

try username blank, password admin, or vice versa.

Read full topic
item.source: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Lolsant Lolsant
item.description:
@Lolsant wrote:

[quote=“508_Client, post:9, topic:235834”]I reset mine and it worked, theres usually a button on the back somewhere you can push in.

You don’t lose files but it makes the router go back to factory settings, which loses all the information in the router except for what came with it.
After its reset the default factory log in should work and you can go on with forwarding your ports. :)[/quote]

Sounds good.
But what’s gonna be the Username and Password then…?
Thats the Problem…

Read full topic
item.source: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @508_Client 508_Client
item.description:
@508_Client wrote:

I reset mine and it worked, theres usually a button on the back somewhere you can push in.

You don’t lose files but it makes the router go back to factory settings, which loses all the information in the router except for what came with it.
After its reset the default factory log in should work and you can go on with forwarding your ports.

Read full topic

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @pure_wc1994 pure wc1994
item.description:
@pure_wc1994 wrote:

Maybe ring someone who’s got a basic idea on routers maybe even the manufacturer it came from?

But… While we’re on the subject on “Making Servers” I’ve got an error with the compiler. If you look on RS2 Server Development/Help on search for [Help]Compiler[Help] URGENT maybe you can help me. And I’ll get more people to look at this Topic

~Pezza X

item.source: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Lolsant Lolsant
item.description:
@Lolsant wrote:

I’ve tryed Admin And Admin, Admin Blank, Admin 1234, And ALLOT more. But none works…

And no1 Remembers it…

So How i could change it? Any way? Or not? I Wanna make a server… :mad:

Read full topic
item.source: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!

item.title: PortForwarding Username And Password, TROUBLE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @pure_wc1994 pure wc1994
item.description:
@pure_wc1994 wrote:

Well, on most Username’s and Password’s it’s admin. You can always give it a go. If you’re still stuck after the attempt maybe ring someone who’s got a basic idea on routers maybe even the manufacturer it came from.

~Pezza X

Read full topic
